001/**
002 * Creates centralized object for ingredient properties
003 * @author Aarya Patel
004*/
005package src.model;
006
007import java.sql.Date;
008
009/**
010 * Represents an ingredient used in the inventory system.
011 * Each ingredient includes details such as its quantity levels,
012 * price, expiry time, and purchase date.
013 */
014public class ingredient {
015    private final int id;
016    private final double currentQuantity;
017    private final double minQuantity;
018    private final double orderQuantity;
019    private final double price;
020    private final int expiryTime;
021    private final Date purchased;
022    private final String ingredientName;
023
024    /**
025     * Creates a new ingredient object with all attributes.
026     *
027     * @param id - The unique identifier for the ingredient
028     * @param currentQuantity - The current quantity of the ingredient in stock
029     * @param minQuantity - The minimum quantity threshold for the ingredient before restocking is required
030     * @param orderQuantity - The amount to reorder when the stock falls below the minimum quantity
031     * @param price - The price per unit of the ingredient
032     * @param expiryTime - The number of days until the ingredient expires
033     * @param purchased - The date the ingredient was purchased
034     * @param ingredientName - The name of the ingredient
035     */
036    public ingredient(int id,
037                      double currentQuantity,
038                      double minQuantity,
039                      double orderQuantity,
040                      double price,
041                      int expiryTime,
042                      Date purchased,
043                      String ingredientName) {
044        this.id = id;
045        this.currentQuantity = currentQuantity;
046        this.minQuantity = minQuantity;
047        this.orderQuantity = orderQuantity;
048        this.price = price;
049        this.expiryTime = expiryTime;
050        this.purchased = purchased;
051        this.ingredientName = ingredientName;
052    }
053
054    /* getting value */
055    /**
056     * Retrieves the ingredient ID.
057     *
058     * @return - The unique identifier for the ingredient
059     */
060    public int getId() { return id; }
061
062    /**
063     * Retrieves the current quantity of the ingredient in stock.
064     *
065     * @return - The current quantity value
066     */
067    public double getCurrentQuantity() { return currentQuantity; }
068
069    /**
070     * Retrieves the minimum quantity threshold of the ingredient.
071     *
072     * @return - The minimum quantity value
073     */
074    public double getMinQuantity() { return minQuantity; }
075
076    /**
077     * Retrieves the quantity to reorder when the stock is low.
078     *
079     * @return - The reorder quantity value
080     */
081    public double getOrderQuantity() { return orderQuantity; }
082
083    /**
084     * Retrieves the price per unit of the ingredient.
085     *
086     * @return - The ingredient price
087     */
088    public double getPrice() { return price; }
089
090    /**
091     * Retrieves the expiry time of the ingredient.
092     *
093     * @return - The number of days until the ingredient expires
094     */
095    public int getExpiryTime() { return expiryTime; }
096
097    /**
098     * Retrieves the purchase date of the ingredient.
099     *
100     * @return - The date the ingredient was purchased
101     */
102    public Date getPurchased() { return purchased; }
103
104    /**
105     * Retrieves the name of the ingredient.
106     *
107     * @return - The ingredient name
108     */
109    public String getIngredientName() { return ingredientName; }
110}
